Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AN-14 (RA-48 fragment, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; inactive: AN-13, AN-15, AN-16)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, reptiles, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (88.89%) toAN-4K: 56%, I: 19%, V: 13%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC6538 (MIC 4.68 ug/ml) and A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 4.68 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: not hemo.lytic till 100 ug/ml. Not toxic to HEK293 and HaCaT cells.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in SDS.
Literature Information.Author: Wu Z, Cai Y, Han Y, Su Y, Zhang T, Wang X, Yan A, Wang L, Wu S, Wang G, Zhang Z. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Development of alpha-Helical Antimicrobial Peptides with Imperfect Amphipathicity for Superior Activity and Selectivity.
